Name: Jar
Description: Pottery vase with rounded base, wide waist and constricted neck. The vessel was found in one of the fourth millennium BC graves at the key early settlement near Kom el-Ahmar (the Hierakonpolis of later texts) in southern Upper Egypt. This and the other items of pottery date the burial to the last years of the process of state formation, when the culture of Upper Egypt extended over Lower Egypt, under a single kingship
